Connect with Hao Email: H.Dong@soton.ac.uk Tel: +44 23 8059 3409 Google Scholar ORCID LinkedIn On this page About Research Publications Teaching External roles and responsibilities Biography About Research Publications Teaching External roles and responsibilities Biography About Dr Hao Dong is Senior Lecturer in Management at the University of Southampton Business School. Hao brings a wide range of knowledge across socioeconomics and business studies to explore how human action and genuinely responsible management can contribute to true sustainability. ' tu ne cede malis sed contra audentior ito' Hao is the Director of Strategy & Collaboration of the Advanced Project Management Research Centre (APROM). Please visit APROM site for further details. He has acquired membership of professional bodies and networks, including British Academy of Management (BAM), Association for Project Management (APM), Mises Institute, UK Society for Co-operative Studies (UKSCS), and Institute of Directors (IoD). Prior to joining Southampton, Hao was at the Science, Innovation, Technology, and Entrepreneurship (SITE) department based at the University of Exeter and a founding member of the Business, Nature and Value (BNV) Research Centre, an international network researching issues of sustainable supply chain management. In 2018, Hao was appointed as a director by the Forest School Association and the first FSA Ambassador to the Greater China region. Away from the campus, Hao worked as an entrepreneur and business manager, where he obtained first-hand managerial experience and established industry connections.
